paper_abstract: Let be distinct odd primes and let be positive integers. Based on cyclotomic classes proposed by Ding and Helleseth (Finite Fields Appl 4:140-166, 1998), a binary cyclotomic sequence of period is defined and denoted by . The linear complexity of is determined and is proved to be greater than or equal to . The autocorrelation function of is explicitly computed. Let . We also explicitly compute the crosscorrelation function of and the Legendre sequence with respect to . It is shown that and have two-level or three-level crosscorrelation, and all their two-level crosscorrelation functions are determined.
paper_title: Linear complexity and correlation of a class of binary cyclotomic sequences
